title: Richmond Can Remove Last Confederate Statue, Judge Rules
description: The statue of Ambrose P. Hill, a Confederate lieutenant general, has stood at an intersection in Virginia since 1892. His remains, buried beneath it, will be interred in a cemetery, the city said.
dc:creator: Christine Hauser

media:content.media:description: A statue of Ambrose P. Hill, who was a lieutenant general in the Army of Northern Virginia during the Civil War, was erected in Richmond, Va., in 1892.
